intro: Casearia agusanensis, commonly known as the Agusan casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
